content.text:
Becca is trying to decide whether to bake one more pan of brownies to sell at her bakery.

If she makes three pans of brownies, her total cost is $30.

If she makes a fourth pan of brownies, her total cost will be $35.

She sells her brownies for $10 per pan.

multiple.question: In economics, the term “marginal” means “one more.”
Consumers should buy a product if the marginal utility is greater than the marginal benefit.
A firm will hire an additional worker if the firm’s marginal revenue increases more than the marginal cost of hiring the worker.
If the marginal cost is greater than the marginal benefit to clean up the next unit of pollution, the government should clean up that next unit of pollution.
If the cost to produce the next pair of shoes is $15 and the firm can sell those shoes for $25, the firm should produce the shoes.
